result.value:
Zeeschuimer was developed by Stijn Peeters for the [Digital Methods Initiative](https://digitalmethods.net) and is 
licensed under the Mozilla Public License, 2.0. Refer to the LICENSE file for more information.

Graphics based on [an image generated by Dall-E](https://labs.openai.com/s/oWvGAHC0pxwWV3bNLfENu7AV), for the prompt 
'detail of a 1914 metaphysical painting by giorgio de chirico depicting a buccaneer pensively looking out over the open 
sea'. Interface icons by [Font Awesome](https://fontawesome.com/license/free). 
[Open Sans](https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Open+Sans) and [Lobster](https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Lobster) fonts 
from Google Fonts.

Development is supported by the Dutch [PDI-SSH](https://pdi-ssh.nl/en/) foundation through the [CAT4SMR 
project](https://cat4smr.humanities.uva.nl/).
A browser extension to collect social media data with.

Zeeschuimer is a browser extension that monitors internet traffic while you are browsing a social media site, and collects data about the items you see in a platform's web interface for later systematic analysis. Its target audience is researchers who wish to systematically study content on social media platforms that resist conventional scraping or API-based data collection. You can, for example, browse TikTok and later export a list of all posts you saw in the order you saw them in. Data can be exported as a JSON file or exported to a [4CAT](https://github.com/digitalmethodsinitiative/4cat) instance for analysis and storage. Zeeschuimer is primarily intended as a companion to 4CAT, but you can also integrate its output into your own analysis pipeline. Currently, it supports the following platforms: * [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com) (posts and comments) * [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com) (posts only) * [X/Twitter](https://www.x.com) * [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com) * [9gag](https://9gag.com) * [Imgur](https://imgur.com) * [Douyin](https://douyin.com) * [Gab](https://gab.com) Platform support requires regular maintenance to keep up with changes to the platforms. If something does not work, we welcome issues and pull requests. See 'Limitations' below for some known limitations to data capture. The extension does not interfere with your normal browsing and never uploads data automatically, only when you explicitly ask it to do so. It uses the [WebRequest](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/webRequest) browser API to locally collect and parse the data search engines are sending to your browser as you use it.

Due to the technical limitations, it may not be possible to collect all items from all 'views' for each supported 
platform. The following limitations are known: 
* *Instagram* items that cannot be captured:
  * Stories
  * Posts from the 'Tagged' and 'Reels' tabs on a profile page
  * Posts from the 'Saved' overview of bookmarked posts
  * Posts from the 'For You' feed on the 'Explore' page (the 'Not personalized' feed _does_ work)
  * 'Suggested for you' and 'Sponsored' posts on the front page feed
* *TikTok* items that cannot be captured:
  * Live streams 
Note that these are *known* limitations; data capture may break or change based on platform changes. Always 
cross-reference captured data with what you are seeing in your browser.

Zeeschuimer is in active development. .xpi files that you can use to install it in your browser are available on the 
[releases](https://github.com/digitalmethodsinitiative/zeeschuimer/releases) page. These are signed and can be installed 
in any Firefox-based browser. If you want to run the latest development version instead, you can [do so from the Firefox
debugging console](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J7el77F1ckg) after cloning the repository locally.

Platform support requires regular maintenance to keep up with changes to the platforms. If something does not work, we
welcome issues and pull requests. See 'Limitations' below for some known limitations to data capture.

Zeeschuimer

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Update the LinkedIn module to better capture items from search result pages (0400b1af4390abe0cbc253d340d350455fac15b9)
result.name: v1.10.3 LinkedIn fix

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Update the LinkedIn module to better capture items (10c4396dd33b36e7cf4ea69b59b23973ce356c37) 
* Update the 9Gag module to better capture items (2d2337cdf10f1fae3219671bfbeda006c996fa2c) 
* Update the Instagram (posts) module to better capture items (1fca90410f1060c7797c043e22978b49871a8779)
result.name: v1.10.2 Summer updates

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Update the Twitter/X module to capture data from the x.com domain, following X's move from twitter.com to x.com (#34, 28c28cd57478726b4f61a04d31d1ea45456b28a5)
* Added Gab module (this was actually added a few releases ago, but never made it into the release notes...; #21)
* Added Truth.social module (#30)
result.name: v1.10.1 X gon' give it to ya

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Update various modules in response to platform site changes, so they capture items properly again:
  * Instagram individual post pages
  * LinkedIn pages
  * 9gag pages after scrolling
* Add 'TikTok comments' module to capture comments on TikTok posts 
  * The current 4CAT release does not yet support importing this type of data; the next one will
* Add an icon for each module to the interface so they are easier to distinguish
* Internal changes were made to allow multiple modules to capture data from the same domain
* The extension file is now about 40% smaller and uses less high-resolution images in some places
result.name: v1.10.0 Fixes and TikTok comments

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Update Instagram module to capture posts from all supported pages again (#26)
  * Due to changes to Instagram's site, it is no longer possible to capture posts from the 'reels' tab of a user page. See the README for more information on compatibility.
* Update LinkedIn module to capture posts from all supported pages again
* Zeeschuimer's toolbar icon is now grey when not capturing anything, and coloured if one or more modules are enabled
* The version number in the interface header is now clickable and points to the most recent release notes
* A one-time popup now alerts users when Zeeschuimer has been updated
* Download URLs are now properly cleared after NDJSON files have been downloaded (#14, #15)
result.name: v1.9.0 Compatibility & QoL

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

- Fix an issue where items were not captured when navigating to the page to capture from from another website (#23, #24)
- Fix an issue where Zeeschuimer would not correctly detect that the user is not logged in to the 4CAT server they are trying to upload to
- Fix an issue where embedded items were not properly captured on Douyin
- Fix the list of uploaded datasets in the interface so that it shows the last 10 uploaded datasets instead of the first 10
result.name: v1.8.1 Bugfixes

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Fix data capture for Instagram
* Fix data capture for Twitter tweet pages (replies are now also captured)
* Remove Parler from list of platforms
result.name: v1.8.0 Bugfix release & RIP Parler

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Support for capturing Douyin posts via douyin.com (note that 4CAT needs to be updated to its latest release - 1.34 - to be able to upload Douyin datasets to it)
result.name: v1.7.0 Douyin Support

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Update the version number properly!
result.name: v1.6.2 Version number update

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Fix capture of tweets from the Twitter search results page (#9)
* Fix LinkedIn module to not capture Jobs from lists of posts 
* Improve error messages on failed uploads to 4CAT
* `background-attachment: fixed`
result.name: v1.6.0 Bugfixes Update

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

- Support for capturing tweets via Twitter.com (note that 4CAT needs to be updated to its current development version be able to upload Twitter datasets to it)
- Properly handle error when trying to upload a dataset to a 4CAT instance you are not logged in to
- Nicer text labels for each platform in the interface
result.name: v1.5.0 Twitter release

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* A feature that allows importing NDJSON files previously exported. Doing so clears any currently stored data. Available via 'Show advanced options' at the bottom of the interface.
result.name: v1.4.0 Early 2023 release

result.description:
This public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Refactoring of the NDJSON generation code so the extension no longer crashes when trying to download or upload datasets of more than ~12,500 items
* Support for collecting Parler posts (from the feed and search results)
* Support for collecting LinkedIn posts (from the feed and search results)
* An upload progress indicator that actually works and allows for cancelling the upload
* The NDJSON button now indicates that it is busy while the NDJSON is being generated
* The extension can now use Firefox's automatic updating system to update to new versions
* Zeeschuimer can no longer be used in Private Browsing mode (#2)
* Assorted small tweaks and fixes
result.name: v1.3.0 Winter 2022 release

result.description:
This beta release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Refactoring of the NDJSON generation code so the extension no longer crashes when trying to download or upload datasets of more than ~12,500 items
* Support for collecting Parler posts (from the feed and search results)
* An upload progress indicator that actually works and allows for cancelling the upload
* The NDJSON button now indicates that it is busy while the NDJSON is being generated
* The extension can now use Firefox's automatic updating system to update to new versions
* Assorted small tweaks and fixes
result.name: v1.2.2 NDJSON Generation, Parler support

result.description:
This beta release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

- Support for collecting LinkedIn posts (from the feed and search results)
result.name: v1.2b1 LinkedIn support (beta)

result.description:
This first public release of Zeeschuimer incorporates the following updates and fixes:

- Per-platform data collection toggle
- Reorganized interface
- Updated graphics
- Add links to worksheet and Zenodo to Readme
result.name: v1.1 First public release

result.description: This release incorporates no new fixes or features, but is made for technical reasons.
result.name: v1.0b9 Beta release for Zenodo

result.description:
This Zeeschuimer beta version incorporates the following updates and fixes:

- Fix an issue where items were not collected from TikTok search results if there were items in the results that were not posts (e.g. suggested accounts).
result.name: v1.0b9 Beta release

result.description:
This Zeeschuimer beta version incorporates the following updates and fixes:

- Also extract TikTok posts from the 'Top' search results (instead of only the 'Videos' tab)
result.name: v1.0b8 Beta release

result.description:
This Zeeschuimer beta version incorporates the following updates and fixes:

- Fixed extraction of TikTok results from page source code.
result.name: v1.0b7 Beta release

result.description:
This Zeeschuimer beta version incorporates the following updates and fixes:

- Fixed capture of items from Instagram timeline feeds
- Fixed capture of items from TikTok search results
result.name: v1.0b6 Beta release

result.description:
This Zeeschuimer beta version incorporates the following updates and fixes:

* Also capture TikTok posts embedded on page (instead of loaded asynchronously on-the-fly). This should fix an issue where sometimes the first items on a page (at the top, immediately visible) would not be captured.
result.name: v1.0b5 Beta release

result.description:
The main update in this new version is the addition of a switch that enables or disabled data collection, so you can browse TikTok or Instagram without capturing data.

* Add switch to enable/disable data collection
* Change data capture method to be less likely to interfere with browsing
* Refactor IndexedDB schema
* Use `storage.local` instead of `localStorage`
* Update Instagram module to capture data more accurately
* Various fixes and tweaks
result.name: v1.0b4 Beta release

result.description: First development version packaged as a .xpi signed by Mozilla.
result.name: v1.0b2 Beta release

result.value:
A [guide to using Zeeschuimer and 4CAT](https://tinyurl.com/nmrw-zeeschuimer-tiktok) is available. Basic instructions 
are as follows: 

Install the browser extension in a Firefox browser. A button with the Zeeschuimer logo (a 'Z') will appear in the 
browser toolbar. Click it to open the Zeeschuimer interface. Enable capturing for the sites you want to capture from.

Next, simply browse a supported platform's site. You will see the amount of items detected per platform increase as you 
browse. When you have the items you need, you can export the data as an [ndjson](https://ndjson.org) file, or upload it
to a 4CAT instance where a 4CAT dataset will be created from the uploaded items. You can then run 4CAT's analytical 
processors on the data.

To upload to 4CAT, copy the URL of the website of the 4CAT instance to the "4CAT instance" field at the top of 
Zeeschuimer's interface. You can then use the "to 4CAT" button to create a new 4CAT dataset from the captured data. 
After uploading, Zeeschuimer will show you a link and the ten most recently uploaded datasets are shown at the bottom of
the interface.

Don't forget to reset the data as needed. For example, if you want to create a dataset for a given TikTok hashtag, first
reset the TikTok data in Zeeschuimer, _then_ go to the hashtag's "Explore" page on TikTok, and then upload the dataset
when you've scrolled down enough to be satisfied with the amount of items.

If you find yourself scrolling a lot to collect data, consider using another browser extension to do it for you, for 
example [FoxScroller](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/foxscroller/).
